--- subtitle: '' --- # Biased transmission: frequency-dependent indirect bias {#sec-frequency-biased-transmission} :::{.callout-note} This chapter is based on "Chapter 4: Biased transmission: frequency-dependent indirect bias" in @Acerbi2022. ::: ::: {#81f98e2b .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} import numpy as np rng = np.random.default_rng() import pandas as pd ``` ::: ::: {#f6c98278 .cell execution_count=2} ``` {.python .cell-code} def plot_multiple_runs(data_model): groups = data_model.groupby("run") for _, g in groups: g.index = g["generation"] g["p"].plot(lw=.5, ylim=(0,1)) data_model.groupby("generation")["p"].mean().plot(c="k", lw="1") ``` ::: ::: {#896a5196 .cell execution_count=3} ``` {.python .cell-code} N = 100 p_0 = .5 D = 1. ``` ::: ::: {#da765ecb .cell execution_count=4} ``` {.python .cell-code} # Create first generation population = pd.DataFrame({"trait": rng.choice(["A", "B"], size=N, replace=True, p=[p_0, 1-p_0])}) ``` ::: ::: {#d3199909 .cell execution_count=5} ``` {.python .cell-code} # Create a DataFrame with a set of 3 randomly-picked demonstrators for each agent demonstrators = pd.DataFrame({ "dem1" : population["trait"].sample(N, replace=True).values, "dem2" : population["trait"].sample(N, replace=True).values, "dem3" : population["trait"].sample(N, replace=True).values }) ``` ::: ::: {#9c83a419 .cell execution_count=6} ``` {.python .cell-code} # Visualize the DataFrame demonstrators.head() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=6} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: {#b9778bbe .cell execution_count=12} ``` {.python .cell-code} def conformist_transmission(N, p_0, D, t_max, r_max): # Create the output DataFrame output = pd.DataFrame({ "generation" : np.tile(np.arange(t_max), r_max), "p" : [ np.nan ] * t_max * r_max, "run" : np.repeat(np.arange(r_max), t_max) }) for r in range(r_max): # Create first generation population = pd.DataFrame({"trait": rng.choice(["A", "B"], size=N, replace=True, p=[p_0, 1 - p_0])}) # Add first generation's p for run r output.loc[ r * t_max, "p"] = population[ population["trait"] == "A" ].shape[0] / N # For each generation for t in range(1,t_max): demonstrators = pd.DataFrame({ "dem1" : population["trait"].sample(N, replace=True).values, "dem2" : population["trait"].sample(N, replace=True).values, "dem3" : population["trait"].sample(N, replace=True).values }) # Get the number of A's in each 3-demonstrator combination num_As = (demonstrators == "A").apply(sum, axis=1) # For 3-demonstrator combinations with all A's, set to A population[ num_As == 3 ] = "A" # For 3-demonstrator combinations with all A's, set to A population[ num_As == 3 ] = "A" # For 3-demonstrator combinations with all B's, set to B population[ num_As == 0 ] = "B" prob_majority = rng.choice([True, False], p=[(2/3 + D/3), 1-(2/3 + D/3)], size=N, replace=True) prob_minority = rng.choice([True, False], p=[(1/3 + D/3), 1-(1/3 + D/3)], size=N, replace=True) # 3-demonstrator combinations with two As and one B condition = prob_majority & (num_As == 2) if condition.sum() > 0: population.loc[condition, "trait"] = "A" condition = ~prob_majority & (num_As == 2) if condition.sum() > 0: population.loc[condition, "trait"] = "B" # 3-demonstrator combinations with two B's and one A condition = prob_minority & (num_As == 1) if condition.sum() > 0: population.loc[condition, "trait"] = "A" condition = ~prob_minority & (num_As == 1) if condition.sum() > 0: population.loc[condition, "trait"] = "B" # Get p and put it into output slot for this generation t and run r output.loc[r * t_max + t, "p"] = population[ population["trait"] == "A" ].shape[0] / N return output ``` ::: ::: {#ebc44c41 .cell execution_count=13} ``` {.python .cell-code} data_model = conformist_transmission(N=1_000, p_0 = 0.5, D = 1, t_max = 50, r_max = 10) plot_multiple_runs(data_model) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](chapter06_files/figure-html/cell-14-output-1.png){} ::: :::
